desperately trying to escape from winxp, not having much luck :-/
and I've tried with getting drivers from aptget/synaptic and nvidia.com
nvidia 3d is really easy in ubuntu, but i didn't read you first comment. So waht's the trouble?
you have a 30" studio-display or what?
so give these commands: 'sudo apt-get install linux-restricted-modules-`uname -r` nvidia-glx && sudo nvidia-glx-config enable
your LCD runs at 60 Hz, as all the LCDs do
so set your reso to 1280x1024 at 60 Hz... chances are you get a picture then
your xorg conf looks a bit... sparse. I think the driver is waiting for DPMI info he'll never gets. Change to a console (ctrl-alt-F1), sudo killall gdm and dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
